intro: Pseuduvaria indochinensis, commonly known as the Indochinese pseuduvaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including countries like Vietnam, Cambodia, and Thailand. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and pinnate leaves. It typically grows in tropical rainforests and is often found in the understory of dense vegetation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
